descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This class is an introduction to modern observations and ideas about the solar system, stars, galaxies, and the universe. Topics to be discussed include comets, extrasolar planets, supernovae, pulsars, black holes, quasars, dark matter, Big Bang cosmology, and the search for extraterrestrial life.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Three lectures per week. Observing sessions with the Dearborn telescope

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: The course grade will be based on the final (45%) and mid-term (25%) exams, a Galaxy Zoo project (20%), and two pop quizzes (10%).

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: The Cosmos: Astronomy in the New Millenium (4th Ed.) by Pasachoff & Filippenko
